question_text: The student repeated the method for three different salts, A, B, and C. The same mass of each salt was used. Figure 5 shows the temperature readings obtained for the three different salts. Calculate the temperature change for salt C. Include a sign to show if the temperature change is an increase or a decrease. temperature change = ..............................................................
subject: Chemistry

question_text: The student repeated the method for three different salts, A, B, and C. The same mass of each salt was used. Figure 5 shows the temperature readings obtained for the three different salts. Explain which salt produces the biggest exothermic change.
subject: Chemistry

question_text: Explain why a polystyrene cup is a better container to use for this investigation than a glass beaker.
subject: Chemistry

question_text: Chemical tests are used to identify unknown substances. A flame test can be used to identify metal ions in a substance. Complete step 2 of how to carry out a flame test. step 1 dip a flame test wire in dilute hydrochloric acid and then hold the wire in a roaring Bunsen flame until the flame is colourless step 2
subject: Chemistry

question_text: Chemical tests are used to identify unknown substances. Many metal ions produce a coloured flame in a flame test. Draw one straight line from each metal ion to its flame colour in a flame test. copper ion potassium ion sodium ion orange-red red yellow blue-green lilac metal ion flame colour
subject: Chemistry

question_text: Some metal ions can be identified using sodium hydroxide solution. Drops of sodium hydroxide solution were added to a solution containing iron(III) ions, Fe3+. What would be seen? A blue solution B green liquid C red-brown precipitate D yellow gas
subject: Chemistry

question_text: In the test for carbonate ions, dilute hydrochloric acid is added to the solid carbonate in a test tube. A gas is given off. Give the name of this gas.
subject: Chemistry

question_text: In the test for carbonate ions, dilute hydrochloric acid is added to the solid carbonate in a test tube. A gas is given off. Figure 6 shows the apparatus that a student set up to test for this gas. This apparatus will not work. State what change is needed so that bubbles of the gas can pass through the limewater.
subject: Chemistry

question_text: A compound that contained ammonium ions was dissolved in water. A solution was formed. Sodium hydroxide solution was added, and the mixture was heated. A gas was given off. This gas was tested with a piece of damp red litmus paper. The litmus paper turned blue. Name the gas that was given off.
subject: Chemistry

question_text: A scientist produced the information in Figure 7 about the Earth’s atmosphere and the Earth’s average surface temperature. Complete the bar chart showing the composition of the Earth’s atmosphere 3 billion years ago by adding a bar to show the percentage of carbon dioxide. carbon dioxide water vapour all other gases
subject: Chemistry
